resources.string: Welcome to the Aquarium Information App!!
Use the Bottom Bar to select your desired calculator
Your Valuable Review will be GREATLY Appreciated!! Thank you!!
Would you kindly rate this App?
This app was created by Nick White from North Florida. I am not a programmer, but an enthusiastic aquarist. I went to school for biology and have been in the hobby for over 10 years.

I got tired of having to search for converters every time I wanted to convert meq/L to dKH or determine my new tank’s size. The most commonly used products vary widely in which units are used, and I wanted to create a quick access app to confirm I was dosing the appropriate amount.
Please, inform me of ANY errors. I tried my best to build this app, but I am new to app programming.

-Testing Water Temp is set to 77 °F or 25 °C. Ability to set custom Testing Water Temp is coming! 

-The direct calculation from Salinity (‰ - ppt) to Density (g/l or kg/m3) / Specific Gravity is based on the equation adopted by UNESCO - The One Atmosphere International Equation of the State of Seawater (Millero and Poisson, 1981). 

-The inverse calculation, from Specific Density / Gravity to Salinity, is performed by the solution for iterative methods of the reverse equation of Millero and Poisson. 

-The calculation from Conductivity to Salinity / Density / Gravity Specification is performed according to the complex polynomial equation adopted by UNESCO/ICES/SCOR/IAPSO. In this case,the values are reliable for the resulting salinity between 2 and 42 and a temperature between -2 °C and 35 °C. 

-Salinity values are expressed in Practical Salinity. 

-Thanks to OceanLife.com for providing the source code for the calculations.

This App is more than just a simple Unit Converter: It's tailored more towards Aquarists or anyone interested in water chemistry. 

Not only is there a simple Temperature Converter, but also a Salinity and Alkalinity (KH) converter. 

There’s also a CO₂ calculator for planted aquariums. Also included are Tank Volume Calculators, which will calculate a tank’s volume in gallons or liters and include its water weight. 

There will be more to come including specific aquarium parameters, maintenance plans and more!! If you like this app, please rate it!

Wanting to get new fish but dunno if they will play nicely with what you already have? Just added is a quick reference tool to determine which fish types are compatible with which.\nNOTE:, this feature is in BETA. Mistakes may be present, but I am diligently working on everything!
